1.text: Therefore in the liberty which Christ has freed us, stand ye, and be not again held in the yoke of servitude.

2.text: Behold, I Paul say to you, that if ye be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

3.text: And again to any man circumcised, I testify, that he is debtor to do the whole law.

4.text: Ye were neglected from Christ, whoever are justified in the law; ye have fallen from grace.

5.text: For we in spirit by faith expect the hope of justice.

6.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision has any power, nor uncircumcision; but faith being energetic through love.

7.text: Ye were running well; who hindered you not to obey the truth?

8.text: The confidence not from him calling you.

9.text: A little leaven leavens the whole mixture.

10.text: I have trusted to you in the Lord, that ye will have nothing different in mind; and he troubling you shall bear judgment, whoever he be.

11.text: And I, brethren, if I yet proclaim circumcision, why am I. yet driven out? therefore the offence of the cross is left unemployed.

12.text: I would also they shall be cut off who having risen up against you.

13.text: For ye were called to liberty brethren; only not liberty for an occasion to the flesh, but through love serve ye one another.

14.text: For all the law is completed in one word, in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

15.text: And if ye bite and devour one another, see ye that ye be not laid waste by one another.

16.text: And I say, Walk in Spirit, and complete not the desire of the flesh.

17.text: For the flesh desires against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are adverse to one another: that not the things ye would, these should ye do.

18.text: And if ye are led by the Spirit, ye are not under the law.

19.text: And the works of the flesh are manifest, which are; Adultery, fornication, uncleanness, licentiousness,

20.text: Idolatry, charm, enmities, strifes, jealousies, wraths, intriguings, seditions, sects.

21.text: Envyings, slaughters, drunkenness, revelries, and the like: to these which I foretell you, as I have also said before, that they doing such shall not inherit the kingdom of God.

22.text: And the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faith,

23.text: Meekness, temperance: against such is no law.

24.text: And they of Christ have crucified the flesh with the passions and desires.

25.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

26.text: Let us not be vainglorious, provoking one another, envying one another.
